items.title: Taiwan Imposes Export Controls on Huawei and SMIC Impacting AI Chip Development
items.author: Anthony Ha, Brian Heater
items.summary: Taiwan has placed export controls on Chinese tech giants Huawei and SMIC, requiring government approval for shipments and restricting access to critical AI chip manufacturing resources. This move could significantly hinder China’s semiconductor advancements amid ongoing technology and security tensions. Understanding this helps gauge the evolving geopolitical tech landscape.

items.title: Alexa von Tobel's Vision for Fintech 3.0 and Venture Capital Innovation
items.summary: Alexa von Tobel reflects on her journey from founding LearnVest to launching Inspired Capital, emphasizing fintech 3.0 as a wave of deep product reinvention addressing economic and demographic shifts. Her venture firm focuses on long-term, founder-centric investments, signaling a transformative future in financial technology and startup support.

items.title: Google Plans to End Partnership with Scale AI Amid Meta’s Major Investment
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary: Google is reportedly planning to cut ties with Scale AI following Meta’s $14.3 billion investment in the startup, prompting other major clients like Microsoft to reconsider their relationships. Scale AI remains operational and independent, continuing to serve key sectors including generative AI and government. This shift signals evolving dynamics in AI data annotation services amid rising competition.

items.title: How to Delete Your 23andMe Genetic Data Amid Company Bankruptcy
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary: Following 23andMe's bankruptcy and acquisition disputes, 15% of its 15 million customers have requested deletion of their genetic data amid privacy concerns. This guide outlines how users can permanently delete data or revoke consent for research use, highlighting the importance of protecting familial genetic information.

items.title: Waymo Limits Service Ahead of Nationwide 'No Kings' Protests
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary: Waymo has restricted its robotaxi services across multiple cities, including a full suspension in Los Angeles, due to planned nationwide 'No Kings' protests against President Trump. This precaution follows recent attacks on Waymo vehicles amid tensions over immigration enforcement policies. The move highlights the intersection of technology, civil unrest, and public safety.

items.title: WWDC 2025 Highlights and Major Tech Updates This Week
items.author: Karyne Levy
items.summary: WWDC 2025 showcased Apple's new iOS 26 and key product updates amid AI industry pressures and legal challenges. Major tech news includes Tesla's upcoming robotaxi launch, OpenAI’s advancements, and Google’s Android 16 release, all signaling significant shifts in AI and consumer technology landscapes.

items.title: Apple's App Store Introduces AI-Generated Tags in iOS 26 Developer Beta
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary: Apple has launched AI-generated tags for apps in the iOS 26 developer beta to enhance discoverability. These tags, derived from app metadata including screenshots, aim to improve search rankings without developers needing to adjust keywords. This innovation signifies a shift towards AI-driven app categorization, promising better app visibility once publicly implemented.

items.title: Inside TechCrunch All Stage: A One-Day Hub for Investors and Startup Deal Flow
items.summary: TechCrunch All Stage offers investors a unique one-floor event in Boston, July 15, enabling direct access to founders without intermediaries. It fosters genuine connections, mentorship, and deal acceleration, making it essential for early-stage investors seeking new opportunities and insights in the tech ecosystem.

items.title: Anne Wojcicki’s Nonprofit Wins Bid to Acquire 23andMe Amid Bankruptcy and Legal Challenges
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary: Anne Wojcicki’s nonprofit TTAM Research Institute secured a $305 million deal to acquire 23andMe after its bankruptcy and a competing bid from Regeneron. The acquisition emphasizes customer privacy and data control, though legal challenges and consumer trust remain significant hurdles.

items.title: New York Passes RAISE Act to Enforce AI Safety and Transparency
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary: New York lawmakers passed the RAISE Act to mandate transparency and safety standards for frontier AI models, aiming to prevent AI-driven disasters while avoiding stifling innovation. This pioneering legislation addresses risks posed by AI giants and signals a crucial step in responsible AI governance.

items.title: Clay Raises Series C at $3 Billion Valuation, Led by CapitalG
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary: Clay, a sales automation startup, secured a $3 billion valuation through a Series C funding round led by CapitalG, reflecting rapid growth fueled by AI-driven sales tools. This milestone highlights Clay's expanding influence among major clients and its competitive position in the sales tech landscape.

items.title: Meta's Partial Acquisition of Scale Valued at Over $29 Billion Brings Major Liquidity to Shareholders
items.author: Julie Bort
items.summary: Meta's acquisition of a 49% stake in AI startup Scale, valuing the company above $29 billion, provides significant liquidity to shareholders while retaining their ownership. The deal, involving Scale's founder Alexandr Wang joining Meta, marks a rare dividend payout to early investors and signals Meta's deepening AI ambitions.

items.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Understanding the Costs and Developments in Waymo’s Self-Driving Services
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary: Waymo’s self-driving rides are pricier than Uber and Lyft, yet consumers continue to pay, highlighting a niche demand for autonomous taxis despite higher costs. This insight into Waymo’s pricing strategy and recent challenges underscores evolving dynamics in autonomous vehicle adoption and urban transportation innovations.

items.title: Google Introduces Audio Overviews in Search to Enhance Information Accessibility
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary: Google is testing Audio Overviews in Search, leveraging Gemini AI to provide hands-free, audio summaries of search queries. This feature enhances accessibility and convenience for auditory learners or multitaskers, expanding on prior AI-based tools like NotebookLM. It offers a streamlined way to absorb information with linked sources for deeper exploration.

items.title: Apple’s Liquid Glass Design Hints at Upcoming AR Glasses
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary: Apple unveiled its new Liquid Glass design at WWDC 2025, signaling a sleek visual overhaul likely to feature in its rumored AR glasses launching next year. This design, inspired by the Vision Pro headset, aims to blend notifications seamlessly with real-world surroundings, enhancing user experience in AR technology.

items.title: Silicon Valley Tech Executives Join U.S. Army Reserve in Strategic Roles
items.summary: Top Silicon Valley tech leaders from Meta, Palantir, and OpenAI are joining the U.S. Army Reserve in part-time roles to support projects in data and cybersecurity. This collaboration bridges advanced tech expertise with national defense, highlighting a strategic partnership with lasting implications for military technology innovation.

items.title: Amazon commits to nuclear power, securing 1.92 GW for AWS from Pennsylvania plant
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary: Amazon is expanding its clean energy portfolio by purchasing 1.92 gigawatts of electricity from a Pennsylvania nuclear power plant to power AWS data centers. This move follows similar steps by Microsoft and Meta, highlighting the rising trend of tech giants investing in nuclear energy for sustainable operations. The deal also includes plans for small modular reactors, signaling a shift toward advanced nuclear solutions with long-term grid benefits.

items.title: Startups Weekly: Continued Momentum in Startup Funding and Innovation
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary: Despite the WWDC event, startups remain active with significant IPOs, funding rounds, and acquisitions, highlighting ongoing innovation and investor confidence. Notable highlights include Chime’s public debut, major AI and energy startup funding, and new partnerships like the U.S. Navy’s collaboration with startups, emphasizing growth and opportunity in the startup ecosystem.

items.title: Apps Building the Future of Social Experiences on the AT Protocol Beyond Bluesky
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary: The AT Protocol, pioneered by Bluesky, is spawning a diverse ecosystem of social apps that empower users with open, decentralized control over data and social interactions. With over 36.5 million Bluesky users and many emerging apps, this movement presents a promising alternative to centralized social networks. Exploring these apps reveals the future of a more open, user-centric social web.

items.title: Zevo’s EV-Only Car-Share Platform Empowers Tesla Owners to Earn Income
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary: Zevo, a Dallas-based startup, offers a peer-to-peer EV-only car-sharing service enabling Tesla owners to generate income, primarily by gig workers using vehicles for ride-hailing and deliveries. By focusing on affordable, contactless rentals and reducing red tape, Zevo disrupts traditional car-sharing and approaches $8 million ARR with strong growth potential.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Robots Perform to Queen’s ‘Don’t Stop Me Now’ on America's Got Talent
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary: Boston Dynamics’ four-legged robots showcased a synchronized dance routine to Queen’s ‘Don’t Stop Me Now’ on America’s Got Talent, overcoming a mid-performance robot shutdown. This display highlights both the impressive capabilities and challenges of cutting-edge robotics in entertainment.

items.title: TechCrunch All Stage Event Empowers Founders to Accelerate Startup Growth
items.summary: TechCrunch All Stage, happening July 15 in Boston, offers founders tailored access to investors, actionable insights, and authentic networking designed to fast-track startup progress. It emphasizes real-world advice and relationship building over formal pitching, making it essential for anyone looking to scale effectively.

items.title: Nvidia Excludes China from Revenue and Profit Forecasts Amid US Chip Export Restrictions
items.summary: Nvidia has decided to exclude the Chinese market from its upcoming revenue and profit forecasts, anticipating that US chip export restrictions to China will remain in place. This decision highlights significant financial impacts, including an $8 billion revenue hit due to licensing requirements for advanced AI chips. The move signals caution amid ongoing geopolitical tensions affecting the semiconductor industry.
